page.title: 16An Arboreal Study (cont.)
page.content: As we walked along we used a key to increase accuracy and speed e.g.O=Oak Bi=Birch and so on.We were not surprised to find that the three most common species were Oak,Ash and Sycamore.Also,we were not surprised to find that the number of Elm trees had been decimated by Dutch Elm Disease. In fact we did not discover one Elm within the boundary of our block.After a thorough examination of the woods we collated our results and produced the following statistical analysis as a percantile:Oak-26%,Ash-25%, Sycamore-20%,Birch-5%, Sweet Chestnut-5%,Rowan-4%,Hawthorn-3% Alder-3%,Aspen-3%,Hazel-2%,Sallow-2%, Holly-1%,Cherry-1%,Yew-1%. { }There were various other types which amounted to less than 1%.These included-Wych Elm,Field Maple,Spindle etc.
